lexUnit.name: bob.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make or cause to make a quick, short movement up and down.

sentence.text: His head bobbed independent of his body .
The camera retreated and the dark head began bobbing back and forth swallowing and regurgitating and a hand cupped the blond balls .
When the applause did come it was deafening , and she stood there unsmiling , though with her head bobbing up and down in acceptance of the appreciation .
A seal 's head bobbed up from the waves and Angus was pulling on his oars , heaving the skiff back to the shore .
She skipped in circles round the silent chamber , her great head bobbing like a bird 's .
In the mob I could see Sally 's tawny head bobbing up and down .
The fluffy white head bobbed in agreement .
My head bobbed out into the cold dry air .
` Every time " -- she bobbed her head at him ` especially when you have a room to yourself and a decent job ahead .
A man turned into a baby , who bobbed his head and wept .
He bobbed his greasy head at Benjamin as if greeting some great lord .
The birds just sort of bob their heads like they 're wind up toys .
A strange woman all in black bobbed a grim curtsey , obviously the Mrs Danvers of the Dame 's entourage .
Artemis just stared at her , then bobbing a curtsey , turned away and continued on her interrupted progress .
" Finally , " she said , bringing her head up , shaking her head not in negation but a sort of defiance , so that the tangled black hair bobbed once .
Calder 's Adam 's apple bobbed as he swallowed .
